thread.title: Bridgewater State cops search for suspect in sexual assault
thread.title_full: Bridgewater State cops search for suspect in sexual assault | Boston Herald

author: Marie Szaniszlo
title: Bridgewater State cops search for suspect in sexual assault
text:
Bridgewater State University police are looking for a man who allegedly sexually assaulted an 18-year-old student he met through a social networking app.
The victim was assaulted last night after agreeing to meet the man in the area of the Rondileau Campus Center, university Vice President Paul Jean said in a statement.
The student had been communicating with the man through the social networking app Kik, Jean said, and after walking across the campus to the area of the parking garage, the man assaulted her.
The university police department’s Detective Division is investigating, he said, and the department has increased patrols of the campus.
The suspect is described as a white man about 5 feet, 10 inches tall, older than college-aged, with a deep voice. University police released a sketch of the man.
Detectives are urging anyone with information to contact them at (508) 531-1212.
“Bridgewater State has zero tolerance for misconduct, abuse or violence against any members of our campus community and is committed to preventing and holding accountable anyone responsible for acts of physical and sexual assault,” Jean said.
The university did not respond to questions about whether the suspect is believed to be the same man who reportedly raped a female student in a dorm room last month. In that case, the alleged assailant also was not a student and was known to the victim prior to the incident, the university said at the time.
